faqs.question: What information will be included in the letter offering appointment or reappointment?

faqs.question: What happens if NJIT is unable to give 60 days notice to employees on visas regarding reappointment?
faqs.answer: If NJIT is unable to give 60 days notice, it will support an application for a visa extension to the extent permitted by law, which currently is a 30-day extension, and maintain the employee on payroll for 60 days from the date of notification, or through the end of the visa extension period, whichever comes sooner.

faqs.question: What are the conditions for terminating Research Employees employed under a grant?

faqs.answer: If you don't understand your job duties, you should ask for clarification from your supervisor or professor. It's important to ensure you fully understand your responsibilities.

faqs.question: Can I live on campus?
faqs.answer: Once you have been admitted to NJIT, you can complete the Housing Application. Applications for first-year students received by May 1 are guaranteed on-campus housing.

faqs.question: Can I get money for going to conferences?
faqs.answer: NJIT will provide a Professional Development Fund of $50,000 for each academic year to promote the professional development of GSRE members. Funds are approved for conferences, workshops, trainings, and research projects related to the GSRE member's research area.

faqs.question: What happens if there is a conflict between the Agreement and University policies?
faqs.answer: In case of a conflict, the terms of the Agreement prevail.

faqs.question: Who signs the Agreement on behalf of the University?
faqs.answer: The Agreement is signed by authorized representatives of the University.

faqs.question: Who signs the Agreement on behalf of the union?
faqs.answer: The Agreement is signed by authorized representatives of the union.

faqs.question: What health benefits do I get as a Graduate Student Employee?
faqs.answer: The University will fully cover Student Health Insurance premiums for single coverage of the Graduate Student Employees. Dependents can enroll in non-reimbursable healthcare coverage offered through the existing NJIT plan at additional cost.

faqs.question: What steps should I take to file a grievance?
faqs.answer: To file a grievance, attempt to resolve the issue informally with your immediate supervisor. If not resolved within ten working days, proceed to Step 1 by presenting a written grievance to the Department Chair within forty-five calendar days of the action.

faqs.question: How long can I receive assistantship support as a doctoral student?
faqs.answer: Doctoral students may receive NJIT-funded assistantship support for up to six academic years.

faqs.question: What happens to my funding if I switch academic advisors?
faqs.answer: Continued funding is guaranteed if a GSRE member switches academic advisors during their enrollment at NJIT.

faqs.question: What is the minimum stipend for Graduate Student Employees in different academic years?
What information is included in appointment and reappointment letters?
faqs.answer: Appointment and reappointment letters include details such as appointment title, effective dates, duration, hiring unit, summary of required duties, salary, health benefits, and any costs of tuition or fees.

faqs.question: How many vacation days do Research Employees get per year?
faqs.answer: Research Employees are entitled to fifteen vacation days per fiscal year after 30 days from the date of hire.

faqs.question: How many vacation days do Graduate Student Employees get annually?
faqs.answer: Graduate Student Employees with calendar year appointments are entitled to four weeks of vacation per year.

faqs.question: How much are the parking fees for Graduate Student Employees?
faqs.answer: Graduate Student Employees will be charged parking fees equal to 0.4% of their salary.

faqs.question: What is the Professional Development Fund, and how can I use it?
faqs.answer: NJIT will provide a Professional Development Fund of $50,000 for each academic year to promote the professional development of GSRE members. Funds are approved for conferences, workshops, trainings, and research projects related to the GSRE member's research area.

faqs.question: What are the work hours for Teaching Assistants and Research Assistants?
faqs.answer: Teaching Assistants and Research Assistants are required to work no more than an average of 18 hours per week on assigned duties.

faqs.question: How does the grievance resolution process work?
faqs.answer: The grievance process involves attempting to resolve the issue informally first, followed by formal steps: Step 1 with the Department Chair, Step 2 with the Provost, and potentially mediation or arbitration if necessary.

faqs.question: What health benefits are available for Research Employees?
faqs.answer: Research Employees are covered by the State Health Benefits Program and continue paying health plan premiums during any leave.

faqs.question: When are retroactive salary increases paid to Graduate Student Employees?
faqs.answer: Retroactive salary increases are paid out by NJIT, with new rates effective February 16, 2024, and retroactive payments by March 1, 2024.

faqs.question: Do TAs and RAs need to work during university closures?
faqs.answer: TAs and RAs should not be required to work during the University's closures, unless emergent circumstances require it.

faqs.question: How do I get reimbursement for travel expenses?
faqs.answer: Graduate Student Employees shall be reimbursed for approved local travel expenses incurred in connection with their duties.

faqs.question: Can I share on-campus housing with my spouse or partner?
faqs.answer: Graduate Students in studio apartment-style on-campus housing may share housing with their spouse/domestic partner.

faqs.question: What are the parking fees for Research Employees?
faqs.answer: Research Employees' parking fees are 0.4% of their annual salary, deducted in 24 installments throughout the fiscal year.

faqs.question: What happens if my grant funding runs out?
faqs.answer: Research Employees may be terminated if grant funding runs out, with at least 60 days' notice.

faqs.question: What is the probationary period for new Research Employees?
faqs.answer: Newly hired Research Employees serve a three-month probationary period.

faqs.question: What does the Eye Care Program cover for Research Employees?
faqs.answer: The Eye Care Program provides $35 for regular glasses and $40 for bifocals, with coverage extended to eligible dependents.

faqs.question: Can Graduate Student Employees request a modified duties schedule for health reasons?
faqs.answer: Graduate Student Employees with a serious health condition may request a modified duties schedule for up to one semester.

faqs.question: What is the process for resolving grievances?
faqs.answer: Grievance process includes attempting informal resolution, followed by Steps 1 to 4: Department Chair, Provost, Mediation, and Arbitration.

faqs.question: What is the minimum salary for Research Employees?
faqs.answer: Minimum salary for Research Employees is based on NIH NSRA approved stipend levels.

faqs.question: What types of statutory leaves are available?
faqs.answer: Leaves of absence are available for serious health conditions, family care, and under the New Jersey SAFE Act, among other applicable laws.

faqs.question: What is the duration of calendar year appointments for TAs and RAs?
faqs.answer: Calendar year appointments for TAs and RAs are from July 1 to June 30, inclusive of one month's equivalent for vacation.

faqs.question: How are layoffs or reductions in force handled?
faqs.answer: NJIT must notify UCAN and affected employees at least 60 days in advance for any layoff or reduction in force.

faqs.question: What are the responsibilities of UCAN representatives?
faqs.answer: UCAN representatives can transact official business on NJIT property and have the right to use NJIT buildings for meetings, following NJIT procedures.

faqs.question: When are reappointment notifications given to TAs and RAs?
faqs.answer: TAs and RAs are notified of their status for the coming academic year by June 1 for Fall and December 15 for Spring.

faqs.question: What are the stipends for Research Employees like Post-Docs?
faqs.answer: Stipends for Research Employees include $56,484 for Post-Docs, with variations for Research Scientists, Engineers, and Associates.

faqs.question: What is the duration of NJIT-funded assistantship support for doctoral students?
faqs.answer: Students enrolled in doctoral degree programs may expect to receive NJIT-funded, full or partial, assistantship support for up to six academic years.

faqs.question: Will my funding continue if I switch academic advisors at NJIT?
faqs.answer: Continued funding shall be guaranteed in the event of a GSRE member switching academic advisors during their enrollment at NJIT.

faqs.question: Can appointments be split to create part-time positions?
faqs.answer: Generally, appointments will not be 'split' to create multiple part-time positions, except when grant funding cannot fully support a student for a full term.

faqs.question: What is NJIT's policy on minimum stipends for doctoral students with grant funding?
faqs.answer: NJIT doctoral students with grant funding that is less than the minimum stipend will have the difference made up by NJIT to meet the minimum stipend amount.

faqs.question: What information is included in appointment letters?
faqs.answer: Appointment letters include details such as title, effective dates, duration, hiring unit, duties, salary, health benefits, tuition or fees, and collective agreement information.

faqs.question: Can the appointment letter be the basis for a grievance?
faqs.answer: The appointment letter is advisory and cannot be the basis for a grievance, but it can be used as evidence in a grievance based on an independent claim.

faqs.question: What is the expectation of continued employment for Graduate Student Employees?
faqs.answer: Graduate Student Employees have an expectation of continued employment for up to six academic years, subject to the availability of funding.

faqs.question: What happens if a Graduate Student Employee switches dissertation advisors?
faqs.answer: Efforts will be made to continue funding if a Graduate Student Employee switches dissertation advisors and remains in good academic standing.

faqs.question: When are TAs and RAs notified about their status for the coming academic year?
faqs.answer: TAs and RAs are notified by June 1 for Fall and December 15 for Spring about their status for the coming academic year.

faqs.question: What information is included in a notification of non-reappointment?
faqs.answer: Non-reappointment notifications include written explanations and are forwarded to UCAN within 20 working days.
